part2.question:
Describe an online TV program. You should say:
What the program is
When and where you watched it
What it was about
And explain why you liked/disliked this program.
part2.model_answer: I'd like to describe a popular online TV program called "Planet Earth". I watched it last month on a streaming platform at home with my family during our weekend movie night. It was about the amazing wildlife and natural landscapes of our world, from dense jungles to arid deserts. I liked it because the visuals were absolutely Impeccable [完美的] and the narration was highly Informative [信息量大的] and Engaging [引人入胜的] throughout the series. It was so Entertaining [有趣的] that I couldn't stop watching and ended up deciding to Binge-watch [刷剧] the entire season in one single weekend. I learned so much about nature that I never knew before.

part2.question:
Describe something interesting you saw on social media. You should say:
What platform you were using
What the content was (video, article, post)
Why it caught your attention
And explain why you felt it was interesting.
part2.model_answer: I was Scrolling through TikTok when I saw a funny video about a dancing cat wearing sunglasses. It caught my attention instantly because the music was catchy and the cat's moves were hilarious and perfectly timed. I felt it was interesting because it was so unexpected and made me laugh out loud after a long, stressful day. The video started to Blow up [突然爆红] within hours, gaining millions of views worldwide. It was a perfect example of how short, Entertaining [有趣的] content can become extremely popular online very quickly and bring joy to many people.

part2.question:
Describe a website or platform you use to get information. You should say:
What the website is
How often you visit it
What kind of information it provides
And explain why you trust it.
part2.model_answer: I frequently visit Wikipedia to get quick information on various topics for my school projects and essays. I visit it almost every day for my studies or just out of general curiosity about the world. It provides comprehensive articles on history, science, and culture in many different languages. I trust it generally because the community is very Attentive [专注的] to errors and corrects Misinformation [错误信息] quickly and transparently. It is a Mainstream [主流的] source of knowledge that is free and accessible to everyone. Although one must be careful, it is usually a good starting point for research due to its massive Connectivity [连接性].

part3.question: What do you think are the benefits of watching TV programs?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] TV programs can be both educational and relaxing for viewers of all ages. [Reason] Documentaries provide valuable knowledge about the world, science, and history in a fun way. [Example] Watching news keeps people informed about current events and politics happening globally. [Extension] It is a convenient way to access Mainstream [主流的] culture and share ideas with friends.

part3.question: Why don't young people pay much attention to local news?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] Young people find local news boring compared to global trends online. [Reason] They are more interested in content that might Go viral [疯传] on social media that moves fast. [Example] A local council meeting is less exciting than a celebrity scandal online or a meme. [Extension] Their world is digital and borderless due to high Connectivity [连接性] and internet speed.

part3.question: Do you think some people waste too much time on social media?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] Yes, social media is designed to be highly Addictive [令人上瘾的] by nature for everyone. [Reason] The Algorithm [算法] keeps showing content to keep users engaged for hours on end without stopping. [Example] Many people spend hours just Scrolling through feeds mindlessly instead of working or studying. [Extension] This can turn anyone into a lazy Couch potato [电视迷 (懒惰的人)] if they aren't careful.

part3.question: What do you think are the drawbacks of social media?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] A major drawback is the rapid spread of Misinformation [错误信息] and hate speech online. [Reason] False stories can spread faster than the truth due to bots and Automation [自动化] tools. [Example] Fake news [假新闻] can cause panic or influence elections unfairly around the world. [Extension] It also encourages toxic comparison, leading to poor mental health and anxiety for teenagers.

part3.question: Has the rise of streaming services (like Netflix) destroyed traditional television?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] Streaming has certainly challenged traditional TV dominance significantly in recent years. [Reason] People prefer on-demand Consumption [消费 (media)] over scheduled programming with annoying commercials interrupting. [Example] Being able to Binge-watch [刷剧] a series is more convenient for busy modern lives today. [Extension] Traditional TV must adapt to this new reality or face total obsolescence soon. It forces channels to improve their content quality.

part3.question: Do you think governments should censor content on the internet?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] Some Censorship [审查] is necessary to protect children and society from harmful material. [Reason] Harmful content like violence or hate speech should be restricted legally to ensure safety. [Example] However, blocking political opinions is a controversial issue in many democratic countries. [Extension] Balancing freedom of speech and safety is a difficult but necessary task for governments.
